page.title: 10CAVES ON MENDIP
page.content: The Carboniferous limestone underlying this block is chemically weathered by rain water-a weak acid-which penetrates the rock through its joints & bedding planes. Entering at swallets, the water eventually forms underground passages & caverns. The caves in this block can be extensive-Longwood Swallet is about 1500m long. Rhino Rift is nearly 170m deep. Many contain stalactites, stalagmites and other spectacular features, though some have been destroyed by carelessness over the years. Water entering cave systems in this block have been traced by dyes to Cheddar Rising and Wookey Hole. Below the water table the speed of flow is very slow indeed as the gaps are much smaller.
